bibl.title: Parmeniskos Group: Evidence from Alexandria - Egypt.
bibl.note: The 'Parmeniskos Group' was first identified by V.R. Grace among the material from the Pnyx excavations with regard to their characteristic stamps bearing two lines of inscription or monograms. Their production center has been discussed for a long time till their discovery in huge quantity at Pella-Macedonia. Presents their Eastern Mediterranean expansion by means of material attested in the rescue excavations made by the Center for Alexandrian Studies. - Avec résumé en anglais et en turc.
bibl.seg: Gonca Cankardeş-Şenol, Parmeniskos Group: Evidence from Alexandria - Egypt.
Arkeoloji Dergisi [Ege Üniversitesi, İzmir] 9 (2007) 1, pp. 85-90, 5 figg.

The 'Parmeniskos Group' was first identified by V.R. Grace among the material from the Pnyx excavations with regard to their characteristic stamps bearing two lines of inscription or monograms. Their production center has been discussed for a long time till their discovery in huge quantity at Pella-Macedonia. Presents their Eastern Mediterranean expansion by means of material attested in the rescue excavations made by the Center for Alexandrian Studies. - Avec résumé en anglais et en turc.
